title: Introduction to `noreden`
text: Input data try visualize results  Percentage  Can actually put side side.
code: data_newdiet #>                 food_name current    new absolute_change percent_change #> 1                   Bread  188.32 189.11            0.79            0.4 #> 2            Other grains   48.31  46.07           -2.24           -4.6 #> 3                Potatoes   72.79  72.45           -0.35           -0.5 #> 4              Vegetables  165.99 163.69           -2.30           -1.4 #> 5          Fruit, berries  184.13 182.43           -1.70           -0.9 #> 6                Red meat  126.26  98.97          -27.29          -21.6 #> 7                    Fish   74.62  73.18           -1.44           -1.9 #> 8                    Eggs   26.41  27.18            0.77            2.9 #> 9           Milk, yoghurt  328.65 325.98           -2.67           -0.8 #> 10                 Cheese   46.60  30.64          -15.96          -34.3 #> 11 Butter, margarine, oil   32.32  34.41            2.09            6.5 #> 12          Sugar, sweets   18.14  13.07           -5.08          -28.0 #>    diet_bound_lwr diet_bound_upr #> 1           18.83          343.8 #> 2            4.83          155.7 #> 3            7.28          230.7 #> 4           16.60          419.7 #> 5           18.41          552.7 #> 6           12.63          299.6 #> 7            7.46          302.9 #> 8            2.64          111.6 #> 9           32.86          900.6 #> 10           4.66          121.6 #> 11           3.23           71.4 #> 12           1.81           66.0 ddd <- prep_diet_comparison_gram(data_dietsummary = data_newdiet) p1 <- plot(plot_obj = ddd,      title_text = 'New diet',      axis_x_text = 'Food groups',      axis_y_text = 'Intake (grams)') p1 ddd <- prep_diet_comparison_percent(data_dietsummary = data_newdiet) p2 <- plot(plot_obj = ddd,      title_text = 'Percent change',      axis_x_text = 'Food groups',      axis_y_text = 'Percent') p2 library(patchwork) p1 + p2 + plot_layout(nrow = 1)
